Package Ch08_BinaryRegions

Class Region_Eccentricity_Ellipse_Demo

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ch08_BinaryRegions.Region_Eccentricity_Ellipse_Demo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
    public class Region_Eccentricity_Ellipse_Demo
extends Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

    Performs binary region segmentation, then displays each region's major axis (scaled by eccentricity) and equivalent ellipse as a vector overlay. See Sec. 8.6.2 and 8.6.3 of [1] for additional details. This plugin expects a binary (black and white) image with background = 0 and foreground > 0. Display lookup tables (LUTs) are not considered. Eccentricity values are limited to MaxEccentricity, axes are marked red if exceeded. Axes for regions with NaN eccentricity value (single-pixel regions) are not displayed. Axis and ellipse parameters are calculated from the region's central moments.

    [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, Digital Image Processing – An Algorithmic Introduction, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).

    Version:
    2021/04/18, 2022/09/27 revised ellipse generation, overlay
